clinical_study.brief_title: Prognostic Role of Minimal Residual Disease in Acute Myeloid Leukemia
clinical_study.official_title: Ruolo Prognostico Della Malattia Minima Residua Nella Leucemia Mieloide Acuta

lead_sponsor.agency: Azienda Ospedaliera Città della Salute e della Scienza di Torino

clinical_study.source: Azienda Ospedaliera Città della Salute e della Scienza di Torino

brief_summary.textblock: Study purpose is to assess the prognostic role of Minimal Residual Disease (defined as medullary expression of WT1 gene), performed at Baseline and during treatment according to clinical practice. MRD results will be relate to treatment outcome and survival analysis variables (Overall Survival, Disease Free Survival, Cumulative Incidence of Relapse)

primary_outcome.time_frame: +28 days after End of induction chemotherapy - Before Allogeneic Transplant, average of 3 to 6 months from beginning of therapy

secondary_outcome.time_frame: +28 days after End of induction chemotherapy -Before Allogeneic Transplant, average of 3 to 6 months from beginning of therapy - +30 days after Allogeneic Transplant - Date of Relapse for at least 1 year (up to 10 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Date of relapse or date of remission status

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Date of last follow-up for at least 1 year (up to 10 years) or Death
secondary_outcome.description: Time to last follow-up or death

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Date of Allogeneic Transplant, Date of Relapse for at least 1 year (up to 10 years - assessed every 3 months), Date of last follow-up for at least 1 year (up to 10 years) or Death
secondary_outcome.description: CIR was calculated from the date of allo-HCT to the date of relapse or the date of the last follow-up, with death without relapse as a competing event.

study_pop.textblock: Adult patient with new diagnosis of acute myeloid leukemia treated with intensive chemotherapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of Acute Myeloid Leukemia
- Age > 18 years
- Intensive chemotherapy as first line curative treatment
- Observation period: March 2004 - September 2014
- Bone marrow WT1 expression and Immunophenotyping by multi-parametric flow cytometry performed at baseline
- Written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of Acute Promyelocytic Leukemia
- Bone marrow WT1 expression and Immunophenotyping by multi-parametric flow cytometry NOT performed at baseline
- Patient ineligible to intensive chemotherapy
